problem_text:
A brace (G; +, ◦) is non-empty set G with two binary operations +, ◦ such that (G, +) is an additively written abelian group, (G, ◦) is a multiplicatively written group, and a ◦ (b + c) + a = (a ◦ b) + (a ◦ c) for all a, b, c ∈ G. Does there exist a brace with finitely generated group (G, +) such that
 a) the group (G, ◦) is non-solvable?
 b) the group (G, ◦) contains a non-abelian free group?
V. G. Bardakov, M. V. Neshchadim, M. K. Yadav
